Column Comment.0: PHYSICAL ITEM IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the physical item that is theimage being described.
Column Comment.1: IMAGE SECTION IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the section of an image such asa header section, scale section, log section etc.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: BASE DEPTH: the base depth of this section of the log. Used only when the sectionrefers to depth related information, such as a log curve section.
Column Comment.5: CALIBRATED BY BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFER: unique identifier for thebusiness associate who calibrated this well log section. Could be an interpreter,technician, service company etc.
Column Comment.6: APPLICATION: the name of a software application, such as MSWord.
Column Comment.7: IMAGE CALIBRATION METHOD: The method used to calibrate an image, such asmanual, interpolation, scale detection etc.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.10: LOG SECTION TYPE: The type of section on a log image, such as header, toolconfiguration, well diagram, upper scale, lower scale, section, repeat pass, highresolution etc.
Column Comment.11: LOG INDEX TYPE: The type of measurement index for the log, such as depth ortime.
Column Comment.12: LOG MATRIX LITHOLOGY SETTING: This reference table identifies the type oflithologic material present in the rock being evaluated. For example, sandstone,limestone.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.14: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.15: SCALE DEPTH INTERVAL: the interval in the well bore that is represented by a unitscale on the log section. For example, in the log scale 5 inches : 100 feet, thiscolumn represents the 100 feet.
Column Comment.18: SCALE LENGTH: the length on the log section that is represented on the log scale.For example, in the log scale 5 inches : 100 feet, this column represents the 5 inches.
Column Comment.21: SCALE RATIO: In log scales the second component of a log scale ratio where thefirst component is always 1. For example in the log ratio 1:600, the value in thiscolumn would be 600. This value is unitless. If this column is populated in addition toSCALE LENGTH and SCALE DEPTH INTERVAL, care should be employed toensure that the values correspond correctly.
Column Comment.22: SECTION DESCRIPTION: A brief narrative description of the section, such as thename or title given on the log section.
Column Comment.23: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.24: TOP DEPTH: the top depth of this section of the log. Used only when the sectionrefers to depth related information, such as a log curve section.
Column Comment.26: WELL LOG CLASS: This table lists the classes of well log files that may be created.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.28: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.30: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.33: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
